title: The Mormon Church has been hit by a major cyberattack
description: Plenty of sensitive data stolen, but no evidence of the data being used just yet.

title: Nvidia caught with its pants down, will ‘unlaunch’ the 12GB RTX 4080
description: Nvidia has delayed the launch of its RTX 4080 12GB model after plenty of controversy surrounding the seemingly underpowered graphics card.

title: Google Translate is being hijacked by phishers to steal your data
description: You don't need to log into Google to use the translator, it's a trick to get you to share login credentials.

title: The Rings of Power's Stranger reveal was held back from the cast until the very end
description: Markella Kavenagh, who plays Nori in The Rings of Power, explains when she found out about The Stranger's identity.

title: Microsoft teases major OneDrive changes in cryptic message
description: A series of OneDrive and Office 365 updates are set to take on Google Drive in a pretty serious shake-up for Microsoft.

title: Microsoft Office 365 email encryption may not be as watertight as it seems
description: There's a way to read the messages, a researcher claims, but Microsoft begs to differ

title: Your gadget attachments are getting in the way of recycling e-waste
description: A new survey from Samsung reveals some people tend to horde e-waste as a way to keep old photos from being lost.

title: Intel Arc GPUs just can’t compete with NVIDIA GeForce for content creation
description: Intel Arc woes continue in latest benchmark tests.

title: The Rings of Power star reveals when he found out he was playing Sauron
description: The actor playing Sauron in The Rings of Power wasn't aware he'd be playing the Dark Lord until filming was well underway.

title: There's now a whole new type of Microsoft Teams meeting for you to avoid
description: Microsoft is working on a new type of Teams meeting in a bid to expand the reach of the service.

title: Google has unveiled its vision of the future of video conferencing
description: Google is rolling out holographic video calls to partner companies soon after successful in-house testing.

title: New Sonic Frontiers trailer shows off a series first – combat that's actually fun
description: Sonic Frontiers' latest gameplay trailer shows off combat that – as a series first – actually looks like a lot of fun.

title: Always wanted to work for Pixar? Now’s your chance to prove you’ve got what it takes
description: Artists assemble for AMD and Pixar’s RenderMan Challenge.

title: The Rings of Power's Sauron reveal was nearly spoiled in episode 2
description: The Rings of Power's showrunners and cast open up on the season 1 finale's biggest twist.

title: 7 new movies and TV shows on Netflix, Prime Video, HBO Max and more this weekend (October 14)
description: From gripping new horror movies to slow-burning thriller series, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

title: Ubuntu users angered by ‘advert’ in command line
description: Canonical has come under fire for an attempt to advertise its new Ubuntu Pro promotion.

title: Minecraft server hit with record-breaking DDoS attack
description: A Mirai variant was used in an attack that exceeded 2.5 Tbps.

title: Nintendo eShop scammers helped this indie game reach number one
description: Let’s Build a Zoo is a little indie game that didn’t expect much. That was until region-swapping players got their hands on it.

title: Ransomware posing as Windows antivirus update will just empty your wallet
description: A fake Windows update page is distributing the Magniber ransomware.

title: Beyerdynamic’s new wireless earbuds are high-end 'audible jewelry' and I need them
description: High-end earbuds with an elite jewel-like finish: it's a yes from me.

title: Spammed if you do, spammed if you don't: is Truecaller putting your privacy at risk?
description: New report slams popular spam call-blocking's privacy policy, alleging the app collects people's data without explicit consent.

title: Rumored Canon EOS R6 Mark II could fix its predecessor's main weakness
description: The Canon EOS R6 Mark II is rumored to be launching soon – and it could become Canon's most popular full-frame camera.

title: Has Microsoft accidentally leaked what Windows 12 could look like?
description: During a demo, Microsoft showcased a user interface that was beyond what Windows 11 currently is.

title: pCloud joins password manager fray with intriguing new service
description: Launched stealthily, Pass comes with a unique selling point.

title: Fossil's first Wear OS 3 watch takes aim at the Fitbit Sense 2
description: The Fossil Gen 6 Wellness Edition has been unveiled, combining Wear OS 3 out the box, with a focus on fitness.

title: The Rings of Power season 1 ending explained: answering your biggest questions
description: Let's break down The Rings of Power season 1 finale's biggest moments, including Sauron's reveal.

title: Want to buy an RTX 4090 GPU? Nvidia’s testing a ‘priority access’ scheme with a catch
description: If you’ve been worrying about RTX 4090 stock, here’s another way you might get your hands on the flagship GPU.

title: Nvidia drops a new Game Ready Driver, and it’s not just for the RTX 4090
description: Right off the back of the RTX 4090 launch, a new game driver is now available to download to get your GPUs, new and old, optimized for upcoming games and old favorites.

title: Too much hard science fiction and ‘you’d die in space’, Starfield's Todd Howard says
description: Bethesda's Todd Howard talks about realism and hard science fiction in relation to their next big space RPG.

description: The Rings of Power season 1 finale answers some of our biggest questions – but leaves others unresolved.
